# Connect the Raspberry Pi on Macintosh machine

RealVNC is a remote desktop software that allows you to access your computer from anywhere. Follow the steps below to establish a remote using RealVNC on your Mac computer.

## Prerequisites

Before you begin, ensure that you have already installed RealVNC on your Mac.

## Establish a Connection

### 1. Launch RealVNC Viewer

Launch VNC Viewer from the Launchpad.

![Open RealVNC Viewer](images/screenshots/realvnc-mac/screenshot-11.png)

If prompted to Log in/Sign Up hit "Cancel", you're **<u>NOT REQUIRED</u>** to sign up.

![Don't Sign up](images/screenshots/realvnc-mac/screenshot-7.png)

### 2. Connect to a Raspberry Pi

To connect to a Raspberry Pi, launch RealVNC Viewer, enter the "**raspberrypi.local**" on the box into the address bar, and hit Enter. You may need to enter the login credentials for the Raspberry Pi.

<!-- ![IP Address on the Box](images/screenshots/realvnc-mac/screenshot-12.png) -->

![Connect to the Pi](images/screenshots/realvnc_macOS_2024/step_6.png)

<!-- ![Enter Credentials](images/screenshots/realvnc-mac/screenshot-9.png) -->

### 3. Enjoy Remote Desktop Access

You are now connected to the Raspberry Pi, and you can control it.

![Remote Connection Successfull](images/screenshots/realvnc-mac/screenshot-10.png)

### 4. Disconnect

To disconnect from the Raspberry Pi, simply close the VNC Viewer window.

## Conclusion

You have successfully established connection to the Pi, allowing you to access and control it with ease.

For more information and support, you can visit the [RealVNC website](https://www.realvnc.com/).
